alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:10AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Milwaukee, northeastern Racine and northeastern Kenosha Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 609 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oak Creek to near Racine. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenosha, Racine, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, South Milwaukee, Sturtevant, Franklin, Raymond, Wind Point, Caledonia, Somers, Elmwood Park, North Bay and Franksville. People attending Oak Creek Farmers Market should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for southeastern Wisconsin.
